poem:
**Endless Scroll**

Brain drips steady from sockets,
pixels flicker—Musk's electric whispers
spellbinding screens, a digital puppeteer.

Tweets like shards,
scattered stars, confounding the sky,
his cosmos unravels in binary bursts.

I dive, and drown,
in currents of code and charisma,
inhale the void between words,
emerge unfixed, my thoughts
a trickle of scrambled binaries.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why I can’t stop writing about Elon Musk “I hope I don’t have to cover Elon Musk again for a while,” I thought last week after I sent TechScape to readers. Then I got a message from the news editor. “Can you keep an eye on Elon Musk’s Twitter feed this week?” I ended up doing a close-reading of the world’s most powerful posting addict, and my brain turned to liquid and trickled out of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
